question: If N2 gas is bubbled through water at 293 K, how many moles of N2 gas would dissolve in 1 litre of water? Assume that N2 exerts a partial pressure of 0.987 bar. [Given KH for N2 at 293 K is 76.48 K bar]
explanation: Note: Text options are garbled/ambiguous, but solution derives 7.16 x 10^-4. Option 3 is selected in key, though text in snippet 1034 looks different. Calculation: X = P/KH = 0.987/76480 = 1.29e-5. n = 55.5 * 1.29e-5 = 7.16e-4. We will assume option 3 corresponds to the correct value [cite: 1033-1037].
